title: Watering Wisdom
shortDescription: Learn the art of proper watering
tips: Check soil moisture before watering - stick your finger 2 inches deep
Water thoroughly until it drains from the bottom
Most plants prefer being slightly dry rather than overwatered
Use room temperature water to avoid shocking the roots
Water in the morning so leaves can dry during the day
commonMistakes: Watering on a strict schedule instead of checking soil
Using cold water directly from the tap
Letting plants sit in standing water

title: Sunlight Secrets
tips: Bright indirect light means near a window with sheer curtains
Low light areas are 6+ feet from windows
Rotate plants weekly for even growth
South-facing windows get the most light
Watch for signs: pale leaves mean too little light, brown spots mean too much
commonMistakes: Placing all plants in direct sunlight

title: Fertilizing Fundamentals
shortDescription: Feeding your plants for optimal growth
tips: Feed during growing season (spring and summer)
Dilute liquid fertilizer to half strength for sensitive plants
Less is more - over-fertilizing causes more harm than good
Use organic fertilizers for healthier, sustainable growth
Stop or reduce feeding in fall and winter

title: Humidity Hacks
tips: Group plants together to create a humid microclimate
Use a pebble tray filled with water under pots
Mist tropical plants 2-3 times per week
Keep plants away from heating vents and AC
Consider a humidifier for tropical plant collections
